alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:02PM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Tuscarawas River At Massillon affecting Stark County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tuscarawas River At Massillon. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, U.S. Route 62 near Navarre inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling thereafter. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 700 AM EST.
